III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12404 Placement
Section
Description • (3) An agency's placement of a child in a foster home must
be consistent with the placement specifications for the
home.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Birth Mother’s children were placed with abusive caregivers.
Investigation It is noted that MDHHS Worker placement of Youth A and Youth B
on 2/9/2025 were with Foster Parent where the children and
Foster Parent were familiar with one another as there were no
relatives willing to take placement of Youth A and Youth B. A
thorough assessment of the foster home was completed by
MDHHS Worker prior to placement of the children.
Birth Mother was interviewed via telephone on 4/16/2025. She
reported she was placed in a shelter due to being homeless with
her three children. She reported while in the shelter, she was
under a lot of pressure and feeling depressed because of her
circumstances. She said Youth A was not following her directions
and she hit her 2/8/2024, however not causing any bruising. Birth
Mother admitted she was not respectful to the workers at the
homeless shelter and was physically and aggressive with the staff.
She said she was informed by the director that she could no
longer stay there, and she had to leave. Birth Mother said she
had no place to go, and she did not want to live on the streets with
her children, so she told the staff at the shelter to call MDHHS
intake unit. She reported that MDHHS Worker came to the shelter
and took her three children away and informed her Youth A would
be going to the hospital to be checked for bruises and injuries.
She said the shelter director told her she could no longer live at
the shelter, so she left and went to her uncle’s home.
Birth Mother reported she had recently lost her only support which
was her mother, and she had lost all hope and no other family to
depend on. She said when MDHHS Worker asked her about
relatives that her children could be placed with, she had no one.
She said Youth A and Youth B’s Birth Father was homeless as
well and she could not ask for his assistance for placement as he
had no place to live and was living on the streets.
2

Birth Mother said somehow MDHHS Worker contacted Youth A’s
and Youth B’s Birth Father, and he told MDHHS Worker to reach
out to his ex-girlfriend for placement. She reported this ex-
girlfriend became Youth A and Youth B’s current foster parent.
Birth Father is not the father of Youth C and therefore, Youth C
was placed in a different foster home.
Birth Mother reported Foster Parent is familiar with Youth A and
Youth B as she has a child with Birth Father and they all, Youth A
and Youth B included, would frequently visit Foster Parent’s home
in the past.
She reported Foster Parent “is good to” Youth A and Youth B and
to her knowledge Foster Parent has never mistreated Youth A and
Youth B. Birth Mother reported she claimed Foster Parent was
abusing Youth A and Youth B because she felt this was the only
way to get support and resources from Judson because they do
not support her or help her in any way. Birth Mother reported she
wants Judson to help her get her children back and assist her in
finding a home. Birth Mother denied she told Youth A and Youth
B to lie about being abused in Foster Parent’s home. She
reported Foster Parent is nice towards Youth A and Youth B and
she has no issue with the children’s Foster Parent.
Birth Father was interviewed on 7/1/2025 via telephone. He
denied he was ever left alone with Youth A and Youth B. He
denied he ever hit the children or became physically violent with
them. Birth Father reported he has not spent the night in the
Foster Parent home since the children were placed there
2/9/2025. He reported he did not have any relatives to place his
children with and since he had a child with current Foster Parent
and Youth A and Youth B used to frequent her home in the past,
she was the only other person he could think of that would take
his children in and be good to them. Birth Father reported he is
still looking for appropriate and stable housing. As of today, Birth
Father reported he is still homeless and sleeping in different
places. No other information was provided.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed on 4/18/2025 via
video Conference. Chief Administrator reported Judson took the
placement of Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C from MDHHS in
August 2024. She reported Youth A, Youth B and Youth C
continued with their current placements in the current foster
homes. Youth A and Youth B were placed together in a foster
home with their current foster parent and Youth C was placed in a
3

separate foster home. CA reported Birth Mother is “out of control”
and needs mental health services.
CA reported Birth Mother came to the agency on 4/9/2025, during
a scheduled parenting time visit for Youth A and Youth B. CA said
during the parenting visit allegedly Youth A and Youth B reported
to Birth Mother that Foster Parent was letting Birth Father live in
the home and Birth Father was physically abusing them. CA
reported Birth Mother became upset and started raising her voice
and swearing in front of Youth A and Youth B, throwing items and
slamming doors, etc. CA reported Birth Mother attempted to dial
MDHHS intake number and was trying to report a complaint on
Judson CPA saying Judson was not protecting Youth A, Youth B
and allowing them to live in an abusive home. CA reported she
informed Birth Mother if she did not calm down, she would call law
enforcement and have her escorted off the property. CA reported
Birth Mother became upset even more and law enforcement was
called to escort her off the property.
CA reported this same allegation was called in on Foster Parent
the week prior stating Foster Parent allows Birth Father
unsupervised access to Youth A and Youth B, and Birth Father
was physically abusing Youth A and B. CA reported Judson
followed Child Protection Law reporting requirements. CA reported
Youth A and Youth B are placed with fictive kin, and the home is
not a licensed foster home, therefore, Judson could not open a
special investigation complaint on the home. CA reported Judson
Center worked together with MDHHS Worker on the investigation
and put a safety plan in place to protect Youth A and Youth B.
Birth Father was not allowed in the Foster Parent home until
further notice. Youth A and Youth B were moved to a licensed
respite home pending the investigation.
Program Manager (PM) was interviewed on 4/18/2025, via
Video Conference. She reported Foster Parent is allowed to
supervise the visits between Father and Youth A and Youth B, but
Foster Parent is not to leave Youth A and Youth B unsupervised.
PM reported Youth A and Youth B were taken to a respite home
after the parenting time visit while the allegations were being
investigated.
PM reported on 4/10/2025 Youth A and Youth B were taken to
Children’s Hospital to have a child abuse assessment completed.
No evidence of child abuse was found. Youth A reported she did
not want to stay at the respite home and threatened to run away.
Law Enforcement had to be contacted when she attempted to flee
4

from the respite home. When the officer arrived at the home,
Youth A admitted she lied about Birth Father abusing her and
Youth B. Youth A said she reported this because Birth Mother
told her to. PM said this is a sad situation because Birth Mother
does not have any identified support, and she is refusing to
participate in mental health services. She said Foster Care
Worker referred Birth Mother to parent partner, but Birth Mother
has refused those services as well.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on 5/2/2025 via
telephone. She reported Youth A and Youth B were able to
return to Foster Parent’s home on 4/11/2025, after speaking with
MDHHS Worker regarding a safety plan. She reported MDHHS
worker verbally stated this allegation will not be substantiated
because Youth A and Youth B denied they had been physically
abused or received any physical discipline by their Birth Father or
Foster Parent. FCW said MDHHS Worker stated Youth A and
Youth B were examined by a doctor and there were no concerns
of abuse. Youth A and Youth B denied any abuse or domestic
violence in the home as well as unsupervised access to Birth
Father.
FCW reported previously, Foster Parent was allowed to supervise
visits between Birth Father and Youth A and Youth B. However,
Judson is moving visits to the MDHHS office. She reported that
the safety plan says Foster Parent will not allow Birth Father of
Youth A and Youth B into her home for any reason. FCW stated
Foster Parent, Youth A and Youth B agreed to the safety plan.
She reported Birth Father stated he will not be participating in
services with Youth A and Youth B any longer. FCW stated Youth
A admitted to her that she lied about Birth Father because Birth
Mother told her to do so. She said Youth A said Birth Father has
never abused her, or Youth B and Foster Parent is very nice to
her, and she would like to live with her until she is grown up. FCW
said she spoke with Youth A about the seriousness of the
accusations and told her the consequences if someone believed
her.
FCW reported that the hospital did not observe any injuries or
bruises, old or new on Youth A and Youth B’s body. FCW reported
Birth Mother has been offered several types of services, but she
refuses to attend any appointments. She reported that Birth
Mother has been offered counseling services, anger management
services, parenting classes, referral for appropriate housing, bus
tickets to get to appointments and parenting partners.
5

Foster Parent was interviewed on 5/12/2025, via telephone.
She said Father called her around 02/09/2024 and explained he
was homeless, and Birth Mother was being kicked out of the
homeless shelter and Youth A and Youth B had no relatives to
care for them. Foster Parent said she has history with Father as
he is the father of her child. She said she agreed to take in Youth
A and Youth B because they would come to her house often in the
past. She said she told Birth Father she could not take in Youth C
because she had her own daughter to care for and she was not
familiar with Youth C. Foster Parent said MDHHS Worker
completed paperwork and an assessment of her home, took
pictures and placed Youth A and Youth B in her home on
2/9/2024.
Foster Parent said she was heartbroken that this allegation
occurred because she nor Birth Father has ever hit them or did
any type of physical abuse towards Youth A and Youth B. She
reported Birth Mother has a negative hold over Youth A and Youth
B and encourages negative behaviors. She reported she is willing
to continue placement with Youth A and Youth B. Foster Parent
reported when Birth Father visited her home, the visits were never
unsupervised. She reported she was always in the dining room
with Youth A, Youth B and Birth Father. She reported the Birth
Father was never left unsupervised with the children.
Documents Reviewed:
• MiSACWIS information on Youth A, Youth B and Youth C. They
Youth A and Youth B had one out of home placement. They are
currently placed with Foster Parent.
• Youth C has had one out of home placement, and she is
currently placed in a separate foster home placement than her
siblings.
• MDHHS Worker pre-dispositional notes by MDHHS Worker
dated 5/8/2025, stated Youth A and Youth B attends counseling
sessions regularly and the clinical manager reported Youth A and
Youth B have never been observed to have any bruises or injuries
or complained of any concerns.
• Safety Plan for Foster Parent and Youth A and Youth B dated
4/11/2024 states: Foster Parent (FP) will follow the treatment plan
of Youth A and Youth B; visits will move to Judson center until
further notice; agrees Youth A and Youth B will not be allowed to
be left with Father alone: no family visits in the home; make sure
the environment Youth A and Youth B is in, is safe and free of
hazards/ possible harm; FP agrees to contact worker with any
questions, comments or concerns about visits; utilize respite
services as needed; visits will be supervised at Judson Center;
6

Youth A will be trueful about any occurrences with their father;
Youth A and Youth B will utilize the emergency number of the
worker provided to them or call 911 if at any time they feel they
are in danger; FP will call the agency emergency agency number
if she feels the children are experiencing any type of emergency.
• Court order dated 5/6/25 states Birth Mother needs to
complete anger management program. This order states but
not limit; case management services, PATP referrals, housing and
employment and parenting time.
• MDHHS Worker report was closed as a denial on 5/19/2025
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with interviews with staff, the
Foster Parent and related documentation. The children were
placed in a foster home with a Foster Parent of whom the children
and Foster Parent were familiar and knew one another. MDHHS
Worker completed a thorough assessment of the foster home and
Foster Parent before placement of the children.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
